body:
## Summary
Set up Prettier as the code formatter across the monorepo with Svelte plugin support. Ensure consistent formatting for TypeScript, Svelte, JSON, CSS, and Markdown files.

## Requirements

### Prettier Configuration (`.prettierrc`)
```json
{
  "semi": true,
  "singleQuote": true,
  "trailingComma": "all",
  "printWidth": 100,
  "tabWidth": 2,
  "useTabs": false,
  "arrowParens": "always",
  "bracketSpacing": true,
  "endOfLine": "lf",
  "plugins": ["prettier-plugin-svelte"],
  "overrides": [
    {
      "files": "*.svelte",
      "options": {
        "parser": "svelte"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

### Prettier Ignore (`.prettierignore`)
```
node_modules
dist
build
.svelte-kit
coverage
*.min.js
pnpm-lock.yaml
```

### Plugins
- `prettier-plugin-svelte` for `.svelte` file formatting

### Scripts
- `pnpm format` - Format all files
- `pnpm format:check` - Check formatting (CI mode, no writes)

### ESLint Integration
- `eslint-config-prettier` to disable ESLint rules that conflict with Prettier
- Prettier runs AFTER ESLint (format after lint fix)

### Editor Configuration (`.editorconfig`)
```ini
root = true

[*]
indent_style = space
indent_size = 2
end_of_line = lf
charset = utf-8
trim_trailing_whitespace = true
insert_final_newline = true

[*.md]
trim_trailing_whitespace = false
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `pnpm format:check` passes on all files
- [ ] `pnpm format` correctly formats TS, Svelte, JSON, CSS, MD files
- [ ] Svelte files are formatted correctly with plugin
- [ ] No conflicts between ESLint and Prettier
- [ ] `.editorconfig` provides base editor settings
- [ ] CI can verify formatting with `format:check`

## References
- MILESTONES.md: M0 "Code quality - Prettier"

## Dependencies
- M0-01: Initialize pnpm monorepo workspace
